ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: Timepoint/visit label
AASPIRE Participant Type / Version Administered
Notes: 1= Direct Report (DR); 2= Direct Report - Supported (DR-S); 3= Caregiver Report (CR)

ElementDescription: How confident are you that you can make an appointment (Direct Report: with your / Caregiver Report: for the patient with their) healthcare provider when needed?
Notes: 1= Not at all confident; 10= Totally confident

ElementDescription: How confident are you that (Direct Report: you / Caregiver Report: they) can make it to a scheduled healthcare appointment?
Notes: 1= Not at all confident; 10= Totally confident

ElementDescription: How confident are you that (Direct Report: you / Caregiver Report: you or the patient) can bring what is needed to a healthcare visit?
Notes: 1= Not at all confident; 10= Totally confident

ElementDescription: How confident are you that (Direct Report: you / Caregiver Report: you and the patient) can feel prepared at a healthcare visit?
Notes: 1= Not at all confident; 10= Totally confident

ElementDescription: How confident are you that you can get the accommodations (Direct Report: you need / Caregiver Report: the patient needs) for a successful healthcare visit?
Notes: 1= Not at all confident; 10= Totally confident

ElementDescription: How confident are you that (Direct Report: you / Caregiver Report: you or the patient) can describe (your/their) symptoms or healthcare concerns to (your/the) provider?
Notes: 1= Not at all confident; 10= Totally confident

ElementDescription: How confident are you that (Direct Report: you / Caregiver Report: you or the patient) can answer (your/the) healthcare provider's questions?
Notes: 1= Not at all confident; 10= Totally confident

ElementDescription: How confident are you that (Direct Report: you / Caregiver Report: you or the patient) can understand what (your/the) healthcare provider (tells you about your/says about the patient's) health?
Notes: 1= Not at all confident; 10= Totally confident

ElementDescription: How confident are you that (Direct Report: you / Caregiver Report: you or the patient) can communicate effectively with (your/the) healthcare provider?
Notes: 1= Not at all confident; 10= Totally confident

ElementDescription: How confident are you that (Direct Report: you / Caregiver Report: you or the patient) can be open with (your/the) healthcare provider about your feelings or concerns?
Notes: 1= Not at all confident; 10= Totally confident

ElementDescription: How confident are you that (Direct Report: you / Caregiver Report: the patient) can put up with (physically and/or emotionally) physical examinations, medical tests, or procedures?
Notes: 1= Not at all confident; 10= Totally confident

ElementDescription: How confident are you that you can take part in healthcare decisions (Caregiver Report: about the patient)?
Notes: 1= Not at all confident; 10= Totally confident

ElementDescription: (Caregiver Report) How confident are you that the patient is being included in healthcare decisions as much as possible?
Notes: 1= Not at all confident; 10= Totally confident

ElementDescription: How confident are you that (Direct Report: you / Caregiver Report: the patient) can make it through a healthcare visit without a meltdown, shut-down, or severe anxiety?
Notes: 1= Not at all confident; 10= Totally confident

ElementDescription: How confident are you that (Direct Report: you / Caregiver Report: the patient) can take medications the way (you are supposed to take them/they are prescribed)?
Notes: 1= Not at all confident; 10= Totally confident

ElementDescription: How confident are you that (Direct Report: you / Caregiver Report: you or the patient) can do what is needed to follow-up after a visit (for example, make another appointment, get tests done, see a specialist, go to the pharmacy)?
Notes: 1= Not at all confident; 10= Totally confident

ElementDescription: How confident are you that (Direct Report: you / Caregiver Report: the patient) can do what is needed to be as healthy as possible? For example, eat a healthy diet, exercise, relax, or brush (your/their) teeth
Notes: 1= Not at all confident; 10= Totally confident

ElementDescription: How confident are you that (Direct Report: you / Caregiver Report: you or the patient) can do what is needed to take care of (your/their) health conditions (if you/they have any)?
Notes: 1= Not at all confident; 10= Totally confident

ElementDescription: How confident are you that your provider will understand (Direct Report: how much you want them to involve other people (such as a spouse, family member, or caregiver) in your healthcare / Caregiver Report: the role you play in the healthcare of the patient you support)?
Notes: 1= Not at all confident; 10= Totally confident

ElementDescription: How confident are you that (Direct Report: you / Caregiver Report: the patient) can change healthcare providers if (you want to/wanted)?
Notes: 1= Not at all confident; 10= Totally confident

ElementDescription: How confident are you that (Direct Report: you / Caregiver Report: you and the patient) can advocate or speak up for (yourself/yourselves)?
Notes: 1= Not at all confident; 10= Totally confident

ElementDescription: How confident are you that (Direct Report: you / Caregiver Report: you and the patient) can find reliable sources of information about (your/their) health and health conditions?
Notes: 1= Not at all confident; 10= Totally confident

ElementDescription: Health and Healthcare Self-Efficacy Scale (HHES-21) - Overall, in the last six months, did the things this survey asked about...
Notes: 1= Get worse; 2= Stay about the same; 3= Get better

ElementDescription: (Direct Report) Did you get any help while answering the questions in this section of the survey?
Notes: 0= No; 1= Yes

ElementDescription: (Direct Report) What kind of help did you get while answering the questions in this section of the survey? (Check all that apply): I did not get any help
Notes: 0= No/Unchecked; 1= Yes/Checked

ElementDescription: (Direct Report) What kind of help did you get while answering the questions in this section of the survey? (Check all that apply): Someone helped me use a computer, smartphone, or other device (for example, they clicked on the answers I chose).
Notes: 0= No/Unchecked; 1= Yes/Checked

ElementDescription: (Direct Report) What kind of help did you get while answering the questions in this section of the survey? (Check all that apply): Someone read the survey to me.
Notes: 0= No/Unchecked; 1= Yes/Checked

ElementDescription: (Direct Report) What kind of help did you get while answering the questions in this section of the survey? (Check all that apply): Someone helped me understand what the questions or answers options meant.
Notes: 0= No/Unchecked; 1= Yes/Checked

ElementDescription: (Direct Report) What kind of help did you get while answering the questions in this section of the survey? (Check all that apply): Someone helped me decide how to answer the questions on the survey.
Notes: 0= No/Unchecked; 1= Yes/Checked

ElementDescription: (Direct Report) What kind of help did you get while answering the questions in this section of the survey? (Check all that apply): I got some other type of help to answer the questions.
Notes: 0= No/Unchecked; 1= Yes/Checked

ElementDescription: (Direct Report) What kind of help did you get while answering the questions in this section of the survey? (Check all that apply): Someone answered the questions for me, without my input.
Notes: 0= No/Unchecked; 1= Yes/Checked

ElementDescription: (Caregiver Report) How do you know this information? (Check all that apply): They told me (in whatever mode they communicate)
Notes: 0= No/Unchecked; 1= Yes/Checked

ElementDescription: (Caregiver Report) How do you know this information? (Check all that apply): I have observed the action, behavior, or event
Notes: 0= No/Unchecked; 1= Yes/Checked

ElementDescription: (Caregiver Report) How do you know this information? (Check all that apply): I can interpret their behaviors and/or vocalizations
Notes: 0= No/Unchecked; 1= Yes/Checked

ElementDescription: (Caregiver Report) How do you know this information? (Check all that apply): Someone else told me
Notes: 0= No/Unchecked; 1= Yes/Checked

ElementDescription: (Caregiver Report) How do you know this information? (Check all that apply): I feel like I can guess because I have known them for a long time
Notes: 0= No/Unchecked; 1= Yes/Checked

ElementDescription: (Caregiver Report) How do you know this information? (Check all that apply): I feel like I can guess because I spend a lot of time with them
Notes: 0= No/Unchecked; 1= Yes/Checked

ElementDescription: (Caregiver Report) How do you know this information? (Check all that apply): Other
Notes: 0= No/Unchecked; 1= Yes/Checked

ElementDescription: (Caregiver Report) How do you know this information? (Check all that apply): None of the above
Notes: 0= No/Unchecked; 1= Yes/Checked

ElementDescription: (Caregiver Report) How do you know this information? (Check all that apply): Other, specify
(Caregiver Report) How confident are you that you can take part in healthcare decisions about the patient?
Notes: 0= Not at all confident; 10= Totally confident

ElementDescription: (Caregiver Report) On a scale of 0 to 10, how confident are you about your responses?
Notes: 0= Not at all confident; 10= Totally confident

ElementDescription: Miscellaneous comments on study, interview, methodology relevant to this form data
Individual Level Self-Efficacy - Subscore Total
Notes: Higher numbers indicate greater reported self-efficacy. Sum of (hse_make_appointment, hse_getto_appointment, hse_bring_needed, hse_feel_prepared, hse_handle_procedures, hse_meltdown, hse_medication, hse_followup, hse_healthy_habits, hse_conditions_care)

ElementDescription: Individual Level Self-Efficacy - Mean of Non-Missing Responses
Notes: Higher numbers indicate greater reported self-efficacy. Mean of non-missing responses from (hse_make_appointment, hse_getto_appointment, hse_bring_needed, hse_feel_prepared, hse_handle_procedures, hse_meltdown, hse_medication, hse_followup, hse_healthy_habits, hse_conditions_care)

ElementDescription: Relationship Dependent Self-Efficacy - Subscore Total
Notes: Higher numbers indicate greater reported relationship-dependent self-efficacy. Sum of (hse_accomodations, hse_describe_symptoms, hse_answer_questions, hse_understand_provider, hse_communicate, hse_be_open, hse_decisions, hse_other_people, hse_change_provider_2, hse_self_advocate, hse_information)

ElementDescription: Relationship Dependent Self-Efficacy - Mean of Non-Missing Responses
Notes: Higher numbers indicate greater reported relationship-dependent self-efficacy. Mean of non-missing responses from (hse_accomodations, hse_describe_symptoms, hse_answer_questions, hse_understand_provider, hse_communicate, hse_be_open, hse_decisions, hse_other_people, hse_change_provider_2, hse_self_advocate, hse_information)
